title: How to Catch a Deep Sea Creature in Animal Crossing: New Leaf

steps.headline: Put your wetsuit on.
steps.description: Jump into the ocean and press the "Y" button to dive.

steps.headline: Swim and dive until you see a shadow.
"Catch" the sea creature.
steps.description: You'll need to be underwater over the shadow.

steps.headline: Watch as your character automatically comes up.
steps.description: The sea creature that you have caught will automatically be placed in your inventory.

steps.headline: Learn what sea creatures can be caught any day of the year:
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg\/460px-62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg\/759px-62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":483.35164835164835,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}All day: Acorn barnacle, chambered nautilus, giant isopod, lobster, octopus, pearl oyster, scallop, sea anemone, sea slug, and sea star 4 pm to 9 am: Abalone, ear shell, flatworm, and mantis shrimp

steps.headline: Learn what sea creatures pop up during specific months:
steps.description: March to April: Giant spider crab (all day) May to September 15: Sea urchin (all day) June to September: Spotted garden eel (all day) and tiger prawn (4 pm to 9 am) July to September: Sea grapes and horseshoe crab (9 pm to 4 am) August to June: Turban shell (4 pm to 9 am) September to February: Oyster (all day) September to April: Clam (all day) September to February: Sweet shrimp (4 pm to 9 am) September to December: Spiny lobster (4 pm to 9 am) November to March: Red king crab (all day) November to April: Horsehair crab (all day), sea cucumber (all day), and snow crab (all day) November to July: Seaweed (all day)

text:
Catching Sea Creatures Travel to Tortimer Island. Put your wetsuit on. Jump into the ocean and press the "Y" button to dive. Swim and dive until you see a shadow. "Catch" the sea creature. You'll need to be underwater over the shadow. Watch as your character automatically comes up. The sea creature that you have caught will automatically be placed in your inventory. Learning When to Catch Learn what sea creatures can be caught any day of the year: {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg\/460px-62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1a\/62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg\/759px-62AB02D1-58D5-493A-A315-AEA836CB19D6.jpeg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":293,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":483.35164835164835,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}All day: Acorn barnacle, chambered nautilus, giant isopod, lobster, octopus, pearl oyster, scallop, sea anemone, sea slug, and sea star 4 pm to 9 am: Abalone, ear shell, flatworm, and mantis shrimp Learn what sea creatures pop up during specific months: March to April: Giant spider crab (all day) May to September 15: Sea urchin (all day) June to September: Spotted garden eel (all day) and tiger prawn (4 pm to 9 am) July to September: Sea grapes and horseshoe crab (9 pm to 4 am) August to June: Turban shell (4 pm to 9 am) September to February: Oyster (all day) September to April: Clam (all day) September to February: Sweet shrimp (4 pm to 9 am) September to December: Spiny lobster (4 pm to 9 am) November to March: Red king crab (all day) November to April: Horsehair crab (all day), sea cucumber (all day), and snow crab (all day) November to July: Seaweed (all day)
